metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9949 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The grub_memmove function in shlr/grub/kern/misc.c in radare2 1.5.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (stack-based buffer underflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted binary file, possibly related to a buffer underflow in fs/ext2.c in GNU GRUB 2.02.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9949` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libradare2-4.2.1 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
libradare2-common - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
radare2 - 2.3.0+dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: radare2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0+dfsg-2').
